channel.title: A-Frame
channel.description: A web framework for building virtual reality experiences. Make WebVR with HTML and Entity-Component. Works on Vive, Rift, desktop, mobile platforms.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 124 - 128

My first VR game turned out to be "Attack of the Laser-Wand Equipped Arcade Machines", which I believe is more than enough said. Worth noting is the best VR movement style possible - the pidgeon style! #gamedev #indiedev @aframevr https://t.co/3sCNlbvovX

I‚Äôve always been pretty proud of the logo for my creative lab, Prime8. But @rolanddubois just blew my mind with this early build of an @aframevr #AR w/ #audio logo! (TURN SOUND ON) Thanks Roland! Links to try it out yourself are in this thread. pic.twitter.com/ZbOYXfBrY1

New animation component merged into @aframevr master. On a stress test taking advantage of direct property animations, 45FPS > 15FPS with large memory savings. -1000LOC due to more compact syntax. https://t.co/ol2g9kTanx

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) September 9, 2018

— vyle (@vyle) August 13, 2018

The multi-user WebVR tool I'm building gets a fun, new UI for a photosphere gallery. Even better, a way for users to add their own persistent photospheres to their worlds. Credit to @hannesdelbeke's for the gorgeous sky model I found on @Sketchfab. Alpha coming soon! @aframevr pic.twitter.com/FyvGczPMwv

— Gabriel Baker (@gabrieljbaker) September 8, 2018

Projects

@aframevr Loving it! Space Carousel WebVR is my latest attempt with Aframe. It's not perfect at all, but I really hope to evolve it into something fun and educational.#aframe #webVR #RocketVirtual https://t.co/74QOhjLEc7 pic.twitter.com/je9D9I6CHK

s/o to @glitch and @aframevr

Making some progress with @aframevr pic.twitter.com/to25MHpDQw

— Falak (@Falak76317679) September 17, 2018

D4: I finally got #PoseNet running within an @AFrameVR instance! I should be able to puppeteer a 3D avatar with PoseNet now, which will enable me to stream myself coding on SeeClarke via mixed reality‚Ä¶it's going to be epic!

Blog post and packaged module soon! #100DaysOfMLCode pic.twitter.com/lDzRv6BOmV

— Oz Ramos üßô (@LabOfOz) August 11, 2018

So a sneak preview of the editor progress, I just want to add one or two more bits before i release it - https://t.co/8BqpadFGsE @AltspaceVR @mankindforward @AndyFidel_ @VRfaeVR @aframevr @WebVRrocks @akipman

— Mike Mirabal (@MikeMirabal360) August 15, 2018

Finished A-Frame school and what I got are these shapes on a raft in the ocean. The beautiful 360 ocean photo by user Kaleomokuokanalu Chock from the Equirectangular Flickr Group. Get the full experience here: https://t.co/eQBaYFIu2E @aframevr pic.twitter.com/8BmO6NxPKs

— Yelena Kozlova (@kreatyvdesign) August 15, 2018

Friday afternoon demo:
Hacky AR app which tracks a maker on my head to overlay sagittal MRI images, which are scrolled through with the slider at the bottom. Astoundingly, just javascript & html using @aframevr! pic.twitter.com/cSdu99KVPy

— ùêùùêöùêßùêßùê≤ (@walkerdanny) August 31, 2018

Though I should tweet more about my research: I'm currently adapting a visual search interface (using #dataviz for result representation) into an #VR environment with @aframevr. Screenshot is showing VERY early work. Still need to figure out input and evaluation. Input welcome! pic.twitter.com/jCuDQDIXZv

— Maurice Schleu√üinger (@m_schleussinger) September 6, 2018

Competitions

— √é¬õlfredo (@alfredo_xr) July 31, 2018

If you like it, help us and vote for it on the @Virtuleap competition!#gearvr #virturalreality #webxr #webvr #daydream #oculusgo #oculusrift #htcvive #firefox #chrome pic.twitter.com/ceeKi0XDN5

— Vhite Rabbit (@VhiteRabbitVR) July 23, 2018

Check out @ianpetrarca "Room Simulator", a sandbox that lets you spatialize audio and test out different reverb environments.
√∞¬ü¬ë¬â https://t.co/SNYLBe9Ly6 pic.twitter.com/6mGAlFJitW

— Virtuleap (@Virtuleap) July 23, 2018

I've entered my first #WebXR @Virtuleap hackathon, and my first hackathon ever with my VRBookReader app and platform. It's still in alpha but check it out and vote in case you find it promising or even just interesting. https://t.co/XkFdqaQ6oC

— Stefan Petrovic (@stefanpetr_dpi) July 18, 2018

Check out our initial wave of #gaming and #edtech concepts, including "ARs Attacks!", the first cross-modality #WebXR arcade game.
√∞¬ü¬ë¬â https://t.co/9t1LSKw328 pic.twitter.com/DDJZrUBD63

— Virtuleap (@Virtuleap) July 12, 2018

Results in! Crystalis VR by @alfredo_xr from Argentina wins the 2018 Global WebXR Hackathon for 1st place. NYC's @macspaddy and his spatial audio for stress relief concept, "Prelude", won 2nd place. Thanks to all of this year's awesome participants! pic.twitter.com/EyITOtDgiD

— Virtuleap (@Virtuleap) August 15, 2018

Hey now‚Ä¶! What a great surprise! Composure's "Prelude" (https://t.co/8o283TMJIR) placed 2nd in the @Virtuleap 2018 Global WebXR Hackathon! Many thanks to @ianpetrarca, @rolanddubois, @datavized & @aframevr for all the support! https://t.co/PNegY4YOKL

— Jeff McSpadden (@macspaddy) August 15, 2018

Guess what is coming ! #js13k #gamedev #sword @aframevr @js13kGames pic.twitter.com/0htu5TFnkP

— Karan Ganesan (@karanganesan) September 6, 2018

#js13k @aframevr Game Development Update 1 @js13kGames

I don't know why I created this but I am sure I gonna use it some where in the game just around 2kb for this (+ aframe lib) - Random color generated and gives as light color to see the colors on the wall ! #gamedev pic.twitter.com/UcDOsvL6bD

— Karan Ganesan (@karanganesan) August 22, 2018

Components

√¢¬ú¬®aframe-particleplayer-component √∞¬ü¬å¬ü is ready to go! √∞¬ü¬í¬´
Use Blender to design your particle system, export to JSON and use this component to reproduce it in your A-Frame scene!#blender #WebVR #aframe #WebXR pic.twitter.com/nNc49Bz2YX

— Diego F. Goberna (@feiss) August 23, 2018

aframe-blink-teleportation is my first @aframevr component on GitHub! üéâ
If you would like to give it a try, you can find it here:https://t.co/5uTpqWQdwc#WebVR #a11y #VR #UXofVR #Webdesign pic.twitter.com/rv2JIkbDSj

— Danilo Pasquariello (@theDart76) August 14, 2018

Great effort from our intern Hunter, if you into 3D-Scatterplots check this @aframevr Component Library out! #webvr #dataviz #bhsdigitalhttps://t.co/OmrCUPpUA7

— Matthias (@matthiasfer) August 17, 2018

Just completed the a-ui-renderer primitive that removes the ui entities from the main scene and only renders them when changes occur, it also has an fps limiter too! - LIVE DEMO - https://t.co/r0H49JEajs @aframevr @WebVRrocks @AltspaceVR

— Shane's Editor (@ShanesEditor) August 10, 2018

Articles

A tutorial on how to build a VR bowling game with @aframevr using @PubNub https://t.co/53Sr5Tw8WY#webVR #aframe #realtime #pubnub #VR #virtualreality #publishsubscribe #VRgame

— Namratha Subramanya (@MSNamratha) August 16, 2018

Events

This year's special #WebXR category have its own judges that will focus their full attention on your entries created with @aframevr or @babylonjs https://t.co/FeWVNGiHQX #js13k #WebGL #WebVR #gamedev pic.twitter.com/ZsZLBY1p8T

— js13kGames (@js13kGames) August 15, 2018

Here are the slides for my talk, "An Intro to WebXR", and how you can use @aframevr to quickly build and prototype VR experiences in the browser https://t.co/EAml986hnd //@newcastlejs #VueJS

— Matt Stow ‚ú®ü¶Ñ (@stowball) September 12, 2018

#VR #AR #MR #XR Vernetzungstreffen von @frankbki: VR Beispiele anschauen auf @aframevr mit Brillen: @htcvive @oculus @cardboardgoogle in der wunderbaren @starterkitchen #diwokiel #DiWiSH #livereport #DiWiSHnetworkingSummit pic.twitter.com/azIrxGg63S

— Cluster DiWiSH (@Cluster_DiWiSH) September 12, 2018

Just found out I'll be speaking at @clojure_conj at the end of the year!

My talk is titled "VR & AR On The Web Using Clojurescript" It'll be about using custom HTML in CLJS, @aframevr, and using FP to create #VR & #AR üòä (e.g. these 10 spheres made by mapping over a vector!) pic.twitter.com/oBHqu5XZGZ

— Cwervo (@acwervo) September 18, 2018

Create #VR/#AR content in browser with industry leading @aframevr in our A-Frame workshop. #WebXR expert, #animator, and #author Indira Knight will teach all you need to know.

Sign up at https://t.co/RF2yDjnE8i@cammakespace @DPiPboro @MetalPeterb @ace_southeast @ftrbusiness pic.twitter.com/q0hAAK4F5z

— Collusion (@in_collusion) September 6, 2018

#aframe_nyc @immersivenyc @datavized @debraeanderson and @bchirls presenting their @Virtuleap global #webxr hackathon project (6th place) and sharing some #webgl wisdom for creating pro level @aframevr code pic.twitter.com/7xANHicAaV

— Roland Dubois (@rolanddubois) September 7, 2018

Miscellaneous

Trying out a @supermediumvr Discord! Chat about #vr, get guidance on @aframevr, provide input what you'd like to see happen in #webvr. https://t.co/O7CMahT6CE

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) August 17, 2018

Diego Marcos @dmarcos is a @supermediumvr co-founder and @aframevr co-creator. https://t.co/TABeNdBYrc

— js13kGames (@js13kGames) August 15, 2018

256 @aframevr contributors! ü•Ç Can you help us upgrade to 512? https://t.co/K3A4kwCKBB pic.twitter.com/211Ooq9lLj

— Diego (@dmarcos) September 5, 2018

@aframevr is the most popular tool to build #WebXR experiences time to catch up @AWS Sumerian :-) https://t.co/VoUFFseDtq

— Roland Dubois (@rolanddubois) August 18, 2018

üî´ pewpew, @aframevr Super Shooter Kit! A simple set of components to make a #webvr shooter minigame in no time. Featuring a rapid workflow with #supercraft for live reloading + in-VR + micro file size + low poly assets! https://t.co/0LV9aw83Ke pic.twitter.com/J2Q4gGnaOI

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) July 26, 2018

Working with @aframevr and @phaser_ , created an interactive #VR arcade game at https://t.co/ocEds1hSBw. Works with @Oculus Go using trackpad as D-pad!

Part of a new collection of A-Frame examples at https://t.co/X890LiaOrQ#VRDev #GameDev #VRGameDevhttps://t.co/tWBF3QpYAw

— Lee Stemkoski (@ProfStemkoski) August 8, 2018

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 106 - 110
item.description:
I'm unbelievably excited to share a preview release of Hubs by Mozilla, a new Mixed Reality-based communications platform we are building. All open source, and all running in your browser, powered by WebVR. Really!https://t.co/AtYqAn2qam

— Greg Fodor (@gfodor) April 26, 2018

For those who missed it, you can check my little #webVR experiment "Ye Olde Puppetrilla" here - https://t.co/TGBKHG4KyU It won first prize at the @mozillareality webVR challenge and was made with @aframevr. You'll need an #HTCVive, #Oculus Rift or #microsoft #mixedreality headset pic.twitter.com/j257wxzoTo

— Jorge Fuentes (@jorgefuentesnet) May 2, 2018

Soundboxing (Beta) is one of the premiere #webvr @aframevr apps. We helped a bit on it, only took it a few days to get into shipshape. Now people are getting themselves into shipshape! Via @supermediumvr on Oculus / Steam. https://t.co/QuL2xk0T6B

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 24, 2018

Can you get to the Top 10?? SUPER SAYS, a simon clone for VR, available on @supermediumvr for 6dof controllers (#Oculus #HTCVive #mixedreality) https://t.co/DHivKcO0Bh 1 day to create, 2 weeks to polish ¬Ø_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø pic.twitter.com/gY7gkLqk60

— Diego F. Goberna (@feiss) May 2, 2018

A-Frame 0.8.2 just shipped üö¢ Fixes for bugs that slipped into 0.8.0. Upgrading your WebVR awesomeness to 0.8.2 is the perfect Sunday plan üåû@aframevr Change details: https://t.co/ufupCNDzE1

— Diego (@dmarcos) April 15, 2018

ü•ö Gunters of OASIS #webvr @aframevr source code. Check out the link / portal shader, custom teleport meshes, v2 of environment component with secondary dressings, world generation scripts. https://t.co/518uP5Y0ZX

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) April 30, 2018

Our @mozillareality @aframevr + @Sketchfab #WebVR Medieval Challenge is over!!! üéâüéâüéâ
Thanks to all the participants for the great entries, @Lady_Ada_King for helping reviewing them and congrats to the winners!!!! https://t.co/8VpzT6WKKa pic.twitter.com/LeTUAN8pZM

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) May 1, 2018

8000 Github ‚≠ês for @aframevr. Long live <a-entity>.

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) May 2, 2018

1. Don't allocate any new objects, arrays, functions in tick functions.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 101 - 104
item.description:
A-Frame 0.8.0 is out for everybody to enjoy! This release was the most complex so far. Thanks to @machenmusik @arturitu @donrmccurdy @fernandojsg @reeder29 and all of you that contributed filing bugs, testing and staying on top of things. https://t.co/CusqqHb7Up

— Diego (@dmarcos) March 9, 2018

I've just released an @aframevr component to pan, rotate and scale the user camera on #webvr, inspired by VR editors like #UnrealEngine and #unity3d. #threejs version coming soon :) https://t.co/bDyWnZVbcH pic.twitter.com/iNF97dhpZy

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) February 28, 2018

I'm so late to the @aframevr + @glitch party but I üëèüèº am üëèüèº here üëèüèº now. Cannot believe how fast I can make/run a vr scene. Thank you awesome ppl at @Fasility_VR ! pic.twitter.com/JfW7g4KSLN

— Melissa Teng (@melisteng) March 18, 2018

Landed first changes to @aframevr today! Mostly tests to verify a small bug fix in the event model before I start on the @Oculus Go controls component! Highly recommend working with this project, very well supported/tested. #WebVR https://t.co/sPuiSljJNn

— Justin Rogers (@JustRogDigiTec) March 19, 2018

#WebVR has arrived in Steam through @supermediumvr! Serving WebVR to the heads of VR users. Distribute your content on Steam via the Web. Try it out! üöÄ https://t.co/z6dKLtp8DF

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 6, 2018

√∞¬ü¬î¬ç Search over a thousand and counting #webvr sites on https://t.co/D55A1g1Gq9! Including VR sites from @WITHIN, @Matterport, @Sketchfab, and @supermediumvr. pic.twitter.com/SwDZvLtLAk

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 5, 2018

Projects

1. Lighting

— Dave Rupert (@davatron5000) March 8, 2018

— Emily Dolson (@emilyldolson) March 13, 2018

üî• An edition of the Supermedium newsletter! Steam launch, search bar, developer panel, and fresh content. Lots of VR users from Steam now trying #webvr for the first time. Search and visit thousands of VR sites!https://t.co/X30L6gH76O pic.twitter.com/gmzaB6Zb9G

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) March 9, 2018
  • MaltaJS
  • Red Alert
  • London 360 Arch

Components

Spent yesterday working on a parent-constraint component for @aframevr so I can side-step messing with scene hierarchy when desired. Fun to dive deep into matrices again to make it work :) Love that we can easily access #threejs Example here: https://t.co/vnlby0ZiK1 pic.twitter.com/sz92Vyn3dv

— Anthony Scavarelli (@PlumCantaloupe) March 19, 2018

Perf update to @aframevr animation component. Skip setAttribute overhead for color animations. Animate directly.

animation="property: components.text.material.uniforms.color.value; isRawProperty: true; from: red; to: blue; type: color"https://t.co/T1tGyFbfPt

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 11, 2018

Updated @aframevr animation component to be able to animate any value directly, skipping setAttribute + component update perf overhead. animation="property: components.material.material.opacity; isRawProperty: true; to: 0" https://t.co/nzlQVTdTKN

— Kevin Ngo (@andgokevin) March 2, 2018

Made a simple @aframevr component for cascading opacity to children entities (like in css where the parent opacity applies to the children): https://t.co/sVRkOCLaDy pic.twitter.com/Sm4c4Dl1AU

— Noam Almosnino (@NoamAlmosnino) March 2, 2018

The beginning stages of a cathedral I'm building in WebVR with @aframevr üôè pic.twitter.com/vn8FyGygFM

— Joe Strouth (@joestrouth1) March 12, 2018

Articles

Building something immersive does not necessarily mean it has to be realistic! @joshmarinacci in his two-part series shows how to build a low-poly immersive VR experience! https://t.co/3L9Yp3QY9q

— Mozilla Hacks (@mozhacks) March 7, 2018

Events

Yay @aframevr meet-up, with a @supermediumvr presentation.
It's been 3 years, it still feels surreal to see people on stage with a headset pic.twitter.com/un4l7U5oyX

A-Frame NYC Meetup Kickoff workshop #aframe #webvr #aframevr #webxr #aframenyc https://t.co/1iuofyIRJH pic.twitter.com/21A92hv7D1

— Roland Dubois (@rolanddubois) March 1, 2018

Houseful of attendees working with @aframevr. Trying a #VR scene in their github repo, a WoMoz Sprint in #Dhirajzilla #WoMozTN @mozillaTN @MozillaIN @WoMozilla @mozillavr pic.twitter.com/1OO2ESwBDq

— Fahima Zulfath Akbar (@FahimaZulfath) March 6, 2018

We are teaching @aframevr at the @publicvrlab in #Boston again! Build on the foundation and make your #WebVR do more! https://t.co/pxm1bla2eZ

— Fasility LLC (@Fasility_VR) March 15, 2018

Experiments tried out by the attendees which I admired @aframevr @mozillaTN @mozilla @WebVRrocks @mozillareality @MozillaIN pic.twitter.com/nMomvgHc3F

— Bhuvana Meenakshi (@bhuvanakotees1) March 17, 2018

Learning about @aframevr for #webvr thanks to @RobWebDev at #energizedlabs #meetup @energizedwork pic.twitter.com/ojSsXtghCb

— Marcello Teodori (@magomarcelo) March 21, 2018

@supermediumvr at the #WebXR meetup NYC pic.twitter.com/xXOgnADfAk

√∞¬ü¬ë¬®√¢¬Ä¬ç√∞¬ü¬ë¬©√¢¬Ä¬ç√∞¬ü¬ë¬ß√¢¬Ä¬ç√∞¬ü¬ë¬¶ Meetup announced #webvr @aframevr for Bay Area on Friday, March 2nd, 6PM. https://t.co/z0VL3R3kWe - Come show & tell, chat and hang out, and try out VR demos in headsets!

Miscellaneous

Shipped some @aframevr Inspector updates. Camera no longer gets in the way of selecting entities, pos/rot/scale updates fixed for master branch, üîç @AdamAlexandr's work on pressing f to focus on an entity. pic.twitter.com/aXCEILnTYm

item.title: A-Frame v0.8.0 - Performance and Production
item.description:
The A-Frame train continues! v0.8.0 has been released, bringing many, many performance improvements through being battle-tested in production applications. Notably, we ported many fixes and performance through building out Supermedium using A-Frame!

We hit A Week of A-Frame 100, highlighting the long way we‚Äôve come such that there are companies and startups taking the leap with A-Frame. There‚Äôs even an A-Frame application published on Steam VR! Including:

  • Ottifox - A nimble design app that helps you create VR and AR prototypes that run in the browser - without writing code.
  • Halo Labs - VR/AR design, prototyping, and collaboration solution for teams.
  • Archilogic - Turn floor plans into virtual tours.
  • Vragments - Build and publish your own 360 story.
  • Scapic - Create immersive worlds.
  • Lucid Web - WebVR player.
  • Ideaspace - CMS.
  • Supermedium - The virtual reality browser.

Alongside many other companies!

What‚Äôs New?

The biggest change is allowing to modify three.js Object3D position, rotation, scale, and visible directly while still maintining in sync in the A-Frame layer. There is currently overhead with .setAttribute, but all of that can be skipped for position, rotation, scale, visible by directly modifying three.js Object3D. That is a simple object property change. Since object transformations are one of the most often updated things, this saves on a lot of overhead. In general, we begin to try to find ways to skip .setAttribute when able.

Lots of other performance improvements, both in the core of A-Frame and in top A-Frame community components (e.g., animation). We scoured a lot of the codebase removing unnecessary memory allocations and event emissions.

We‚Äôve also upgraded to three.js‚Äôs WebVR API, which was a long and grueling process to integrate and catch all the bugs, but we did it! Still a lot to be done on the performance side.

The A-Frame Inspector also got a few nifty features such as tree collapsing on the entity panel, pressing f to focus on an entity, and some bug fixes.

Check out the release notes for the complete changelog which includes a list of all new features, optimizations, and bug fixes.
item.content:encoded:
The A-Frame train continues! v0.8.0 has been released, bringing many, many performance improvements through being battle-tested in production applications. Notably, we ported many fixes and performance through building out Supermedium using A-Frame!

We hit A Week of A-Frame 100, highlighting the long way we‚Äôve come such that there are companies and startups taking the leap with A-Frame. There‚Äôs even an A-Frame application published on Steam VR! Including:

  • Ottifox - A nimble design app that helps you create VR and AR prototypes that run in the browser - without writing code.
  • Halo Labs - VR/AR design, prototyping, and collaboration solution for teams.
  • Archilogic - Turn floor plans into virtual tours.
  • Vragments - Build and publish your own 360 story.
  • Scapic - Create immersive worlds.
  • Lucid Web - WebVR player.
  • Ideaspace - CMS.
  • Supermedium - The virtual reality browser.

Alongside many other companies!

What‚Äôs New?

The biggest change is allowing to modify three.js Object3D position, rotation, scale, and visible directly while still maintining in sync in the A-Frame layer. There is currently overhead with .setAttribute, but all of that can be skipped for position, rotation, scale, visible by directly modifying three.js Object3D. That is a simple object property change. Since object transformations are one of the most often updated things, this saves on a lot of overhead. In general, we begin to try to find ways to skip .setAttribute when able.

Lots of other performance improvements, both in the core of A-Frame and in top A-Frame community components (e.g., animation). We scoured a lot of the codebase removing unnecessary memory allocations and event emissions.

We‚Äôve also upgraded to three.js‚Äôs WebVR API, which was a long and grueling process to integrate and catch all the bugs, but we did it! Still a lot to be done on the performance side.

The A-Frame Inspector also got a few nifty features such as tree collapsing on the entity panel, pressing f to focus on an entity, and some bug fixes.

Check out the release notes for the complete changelog which includes a list of all new features, optimizations, and bug fixes.

What Have People Built?

We have released a beta version of our new funny webvr game Cross the Street Fun https://t.co/BWfCqOxxiR .
Do not get hit by the car.#threejs #aframe #webvr #webxr pic.twitter.com/nEPOCVhugl

— sromline (@sromline) January 31, 2018

√∞¬ü¬ö¬Ä We√¢¬Ä¬ôre excited to announce the launch of Supermedium, the virtual reality browser! Download it from https://t.co/Lnyvgt7HBY, put on a headset, and surf dozens of VR experiences on the Web. https://t.co/2rloFZl5ko #webvr #ycombinator pic.twitter.com/6aArQKvgpn

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) January 31, 2018

Today√¢¬Ä¬ôs the day! Ottifox 2 is here - with Google Poly search built straight into the app, grouping features, streamlined UI and more! For a full run down of all the new features check out our blog post: https://t.co/pzcTTGZJz5 Examples to come! #webvr @aframe #madewithblocks #VR pic.twitter.com/6FfpLZjpqJ

— Ottifox (@ottifox) February 6, 2018

I've just released an @aframevr component to pan, rotate and scale the user camera on #webvr, inspired by VR editors like #UnrealEngine and #unity3d. #threejs version coming soon :) https://t.co/bDyWnZVbcH pic.twitter.com/iNF97dhpZy

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) February 28, 2018

Starting to look familiar. #WebVR browser game with @aframevr. Added cities you must defend from incoming missiles. #indiedev #gamedev pic.twitter.com/GtPcIJL7on

— Adam Alexander (@AdamAlexandr) January 7, 2018

We√¢¬Ä¬ôre proud to announce the launch of our first WebVR experience! Visit Pierre Koenig√¢¬Ä¬ôs Case Study House 22 in full 3D on your HTC Vive, desktop, or mobile device. Check it out! https://t.co/SljvOHRnQ2#VR #webvr #aframe #threejs #losangeles #midcentury #modern #architecture pic.twitter.com/iM8AJ8DYT3

— Paragram (@ParagramVR) November 19, 2017

Try √¢¬Ä¬úc o m p o s u r e√¢¬Ä¬ù - immersive experience for stress relief. Built with @aframevr, its #WebVR & #3daudio for desktop, mobile and #VR! Many thanks to @ianpetrarca & @datavized for their skills, wisdom and guidance. Try it. PM me your feedback. Share! : https://t.co/bENdn6U5uk pic.twitter.com/VgYfFLfMbD

— Jeff McSpadden (@macspaddy) February 9, 2018

Numbers

Since v0.7.0 was released in September 20th, 2017:

  • There have been 30 new contributors, totalling 223.
  • We have 1246 new members in the Slack community for a total of 5980.
  • 202,000 people have visited aframe.io since last release.

What‚Äôs Next?

We will continue performance improvements and battle testing. We will look at how to enable people to build more full applications and games versus small demos. That includes disseminating the knowledge we‚Äôve gained from building a browser, full games, and complex applications using A-Frame. Via guides, frameworks, boilerplates, and open game projects!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 98 + 99
item.description:
üöÄ We‚Äôre excited to announce the launch of Supermedium, the virtual reality browser! Download it from https://t.co/Lnyvgt7HBY, put on a headset, and surf dozens of VR experiences on the Web. https://t.co/2rloFZl5ko #webvr #ycombinator pic.twitter.com/6aArQKvgpn

— Supermedium (@supermediumvr) January 31, 2018

Today‚Äôs the day! Ottifox 2 is here - with Google Poly search built straight into the app, grouping features, streamlined UI and more! For a full run down of all the new features check out our blog post: https://t.co/pzcTTGZJz5 Examples to come! #webvr @aframe #madewithblocks #VR pic.twitter.com/6FfpLZjpqJ

— Ottifox (@ottifox) February 6, 2018

I finally found some time to work on some performance optimizations for A-Painter, I hope you will notice the difference :)https://t.co/H5HaxzuDk8 #aframevr #threejs #webvr

— Fernando Serrano (@fernandojsg) February 5, 2018

Come and check out this super-sleek #Ferrari Testa Rossa in our latest #WebVR experience. Lots of UX improvements and new ‚Äúfocused‚Äù teleport mode make it even easier to explore. #webgl #threejs #aframevr #vr #gamedevhttps://t.co/IN2OWSz6Ge pic.twitter.com/CJXj90HMgc

— Paragram (@ParagramVR) January 29, 2018

Come watch the #NorthernLights LIVE in #VR under a full moon from #Yellowknife Canada.https://t.co/cJFo92vYEc@AuroraMAX @AuroraNotify @aframevr #WebVR #Auroraborealis pic.twitter.com/V8ybjQZEEq

— Gnometech Inc. (@Gnometech) January 31, 2018

Playing with the effects component after export, a bit hard on performance, but does make it more fun to view. @aframevr #MadeWithBlocks https://t.co/Z466gPhxFz pic.twitter.com/vPya5tqI88

— Ottifox (@ottifox) February 7, 2018

https://t.co/MCYVBXYiJW because of @vuejs and @aframevr

— Stephane Demotte (@StephaneDemotte) January 31, 2018

We have released a beta version of our new funny webvr game Cross the Street Fun https://t.co/BWfCqOxxiR .
Do not get hit by the car.#threejs #aframe #webvr #webxr pic.twitter.com/nEPOCVhugl

— sromline (@sromline) January 31, 2018

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 96 + 97
item.description:
@aframevr https://t.co/pn9tTomYIN we just launched this prologue story for our game, @GenesisNoirGame! We built it using AFrame, check it out!

— Jeremy "Have you seen my kickstarter yet?" Abel (@jabelsjabels) January 18, 2018

Networked-Aframe v0.5 is live. It features Ownership Transfer and important bug fixes.

Ownership Transfer let's you take control of entities spawned by other users - a big step towards networked physics in @aframevr

Release notes and more info: https://t.co/Cv1pAa19eC pic.twitter.com/X12J6kbxNh

— Hayden Lee (@HaydenLee37) January 17, 2018

Exploring a 600kb world made in #AssetForge with @aframevr.

Next version of aframe-extras will include navmesh support with first-person controls, using three-pathfinding: https://t.co/DDwEWD795r // #threejs pic.twitter.com/TqWITxgAX8

— Don McCurdy (@donrmccurdy) January 14, 2018

I made a game!!
It was initially for the "Games Made Quick" hackathon but I ran out of time so I fixed it up and posted it late. Made with @twinethreads @aframevr and the building was made with @Archilogic3D's 3Diohttps://t.co/TdxgyJkqes

— Ada Rose Cannon ada@mastodon.social (@Lady_Ada_King) January 22, 2018

Life Update: After 4.5 amazing years I left @mozilla and I‚Äôm joining @feiss and @andgokevin to cook delicious stuff in the #WebVR space. We‚Äôre fully committed to @aframevr and the Web. Stay tuned, we‚Äôre moving fast and furiously. pic.twitter.com/JfRskpb5OI

— Diego (@dmarcos) January 17, 2018

Behold! I am a golden god. Experimenting with adding #photogrammetry assets into an @aframevr #virtualreality environment. #learningvr pic.twitter.com/nMZw1IimOk

— Eoin O Sullivan (@eoinapplaud) January 22, 2018

How to import a whole directory in #webpack. Useful for not having to require @aframevr components one-by-one:

Miscellaneous

To keep my @aframevr HTML organized, I template HTML with Nunjucks. Splitting HTML chunks to different files, looping through data structures, debug vs. prod env vars for which A-Frame build to use with auto-setting IP. I create in my Webpack a watcher to recompile on change.
